snippet: Jason Insalaco, the great-nephew of an actor who appeared in Ed Wood films, found and restored a sort-of lost Wood television pilot called “Final Curtain.”
abstract: Jason Insalaco and Jonathan Harris found and restore Final Curtain, a 22-minute television pilot by Ed Wood, which could ignite new appreciation of the schlocky filmmaker; Final Curtain is well-received by a rowdy audience at Slamdance, the self-described rebel festival held concurrently with Sundance; Insalaco's uncle, Paul Marco, appeared in many of Ed Wood's films.
lead_paragraph: Jason Insalaco, the great-nephew of an actor who appeared in Ed Wood films, found and restored a sort-of lost Wood television pilot called “Final Curtain.”

headline.seo: Ed Wood’s ‘Final Curtain’ Plays at Slamdance
headline.main: Sun Never Quite Sets on Work of Ed Wood
headline.print_headline: Sun Never Quite Sets On Work of Ed Wood
